The prompt vector pğ‘pitalic_p is optimized to minimize the loss on the downstream task:

pâˆ—=argâ¡minpâ¢âˆ‘Gâˆˆğ’¢â„’Tdowâ¢(FÎ¸âˆ—â¢(Pğâ¢(G)))superscriptğ‘subscriptğ‘subscriptğºğ’¢subscriptâ„’subscriptğ‘‡dowsubscriptğ¹superscriptğœƒsubscriptğ‘ƒğğºp^{*}=\arg\min_{p}\sum_{G\in\mathcal{G}}\mathcal{L}_{T_{\text{dow}}}\left(F_{% \theta^{*}}(P_{\bm{\omega}}(G))\right)italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G âˆˆ caligraphic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT dow end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) ) ) (14)

GPF-Plus adds a combination of multiple prompt vectors to each nodeâ€™s features. Let ğ={p1,â‹¯,pk,Q}ğsubscriptğ‘1â‹¯subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘„\bm{\omega}=\{p_{1},\cdots,p_{k},Q\}bold_italic_Ï‰ = { italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â‹¯ , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Q }, piâˆˆâ„FÃ—1subscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptâ„ğ¹1p_{i}\in\mathbb{R}^{F\times 1}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F Ã— 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be the learnable prompt vector, Qâˆˆâ„MÃ—kğ‘„superscriptâ„ğ‘€ğ‘˜Q\in\mathbb{R}^{M\times k}italic_Q âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_M Ã— italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Let P=(p1âŠ¤â‹®pkâŠ¤)ğ‘ƒmatrixsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘1topâ‹®superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜topP=\begin{pmatrix}p_{1}^{\top}\\ \vdots\\ p_{k}^{\top}\end{pmatrix}italic_P = ( start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL â‹® end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ). The node features are updated in such a way:

[ğ—Ï‰]i=ğ—i+Qiâ¢Psubscriptdelimited-[]subscriptğ—ğœ”ğ‘–subscriptğ—ğ‘–subscriptğ‘„ğ‘–ğ‘ƒ[\mathbf{X}_{\omega}]_{i}=\mathbf{X}_{i}+Q_{i}P[ bold_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P (15)

The original graph Gi=(ğ—,ğ€)subscriptğºğ‘–ğ—ğ€G_{i}=(\mathbf{X},\mathbf{A})italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( bold_X , bold_A ) becomes the prompt-enhanced graph Gi,Ï‰=(ğ—Ï‰,ğ€)subscriptğºğ‘–ğœ”subscriptğ—ğœ”ğ€G_{i,\omega}=(\mathbf{X}_{\omega},\mathbf{A})italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( bold_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_A ).

All-in-One incorporates entire prompt subgraphs into the original graph. Let Pâˆˆâ„kÃ—Fğ‘ƒsuperscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ¹P\in\mathbb{R}^{k\times F}italic_P âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k Ã— italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT represent Kğ¾Kitalic_K learnable prompt token vectors, and ğ€inâˆˆ{0,1}kÃ—ksubscriptğ€insuperscript01ğ‘˜ğ‘˜\mathbf{A}_{\text{in}}\in\{0,1\}^{k\times k}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT in end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ { 0 , 1 } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k Ã— italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT denote the internal adjacency among prompt tokens. The connections between prompt tokens and original nodes are defined by a cross adjacency matrix ğ€croâˆˆ{0,1}kÃ—Nsubscriptğ€crosuperscript01ğ‘˜ğ‘\mathbf{A}_{\text{cro}}\in\{0,1\}^{k\times N}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT cro end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ { 0 , 1 } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k Ã— italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. The prompt-enhanced graph is:

GÏ‰=(ğ€âˆªğ€inâˆªğ€cro,ğ—âˆªÎ©).subscriptğºğœ”ğ€subscriptğ€insubscriptğ€croğ—Î©G_{\omega}=\left(\mathbf{A}\cup\mathbf{A}_{\text{in}}\cup\mathbf{A}_{\text{cro% }},\mathbf{X}\cup\Omega\right).italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( bold_A âˆª bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT in end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆª bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT cro end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_X âˆª roman_Î© ) . (16)

All-in-One optimizes the prompt tokens and their connections to adapt the pre-trained model to downstream tasks without altering the model parameters.

Preliminary 4 (Diffusion Matrix).

Diffusion Matrix Gasteiger etÂ al. (2019) plays a crucial role in representing the diffusion process on a graph. Specifically, many GNN architectures can be expressed using the following formulation:

ğ‡=ğ’â‹…ğ—â‹…ğ–,ğ‡â‹…ğ’ğ—ğ–\mathbf{H}=\mathbf{S}\cdot\mathbf{X}\cdot\mathbf{W},bold_H = bold_S â‹… bold_X â‹… bold_W , (17)

Where: ğ’ğ’\mathbf{S}bold_S is the diffusion matrix, derived from the graphâ€™s adjacency matrix and model structure, which governs how information propagates across the graph. ğ—ğ—\mathbf{X}bold_X is the original node feature matrix. ğ–ğ–\mathbf{W}bold_W is the learnable weight matrix associated with the GNN layer. ğ‡ğ‡\mathbf{H}bold_H is the node feature embedding matrix after message transformation and aggregation.

A.1.2 Definitions

We provide a glossary and default symbols meanings here for the readerâ€™s convenience.

A.2 Fundamental Lemmas

This lemma serves as a foundational component for proving the theorem. However, readers may choose to skip the lemma initially and return to it when it is referenced in the theoremâ€™s proof.

Default Case

By default, we consider the GNN model as a surjective mapping operator from the graph set {G}ğº\{G\}{ italic_G } to â„Fsuperscriptâ„ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, obtained after pre-training tasks. This operator can provide sufficient information to express the correct results of the graph in the pre-training task. (For instance, through a task-specific head mapping to the likelihood of a 0/1 decision.)

Notations

Here and in subsequent related content, we use FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to represent a GNN model whose aggregation process can be described by a diffusion matrix Sğ‘†Sitalic_S. Here, Sğ‘†Sitalic_S is derived from the model type and the adjacency matrix Ağ´Aitalic_A. For instance, in GCN, S=A+Ïµâ¢Iğ‘†ğ´italic-Ïµğ¼S=A+\epsilon Iitalic_S = italic_A + italic_Ïµ italic_I. The graph aggregation process is described as:

H(i)=Ïƒâ¢(Sâ‹…H(iâˆ’1)â‹…W)superscriptğ»ğ‘–ğœâ‹…ğ‘†superscriptğ»ğ‘–1ğ‘ŠH^{(i)}=\sigma(S\cdot H^{(i-1)}\cdot W)italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_i ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S â‹… italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_i - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹… italic_W ) (18)

Where H(0)superscriptğ»0H^{(0)}italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is exactly the node feature matrix Xğ‘‹Xitalic_X, and H(i)superscriptğ»ğ‘–H^{(i)}italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_i ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is referred to as the i-th order embedding matrix. Without loss of generality, we analyze the non-linear function Ïƒğœ\sigmaitalic_Ïƒ using Leaky ReLU. Other non-linear functions such as sigmoid can be analyzed similarly.

Denote the transformation space of PÏ‰subscriptğ‘ƒğœ”P_{\omega}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and GğºGitalic_G by DPâ¢(G)={PÏ‰â¢(G)|Ï‰âˆˆâ„|Ï‰|}subscriptğ·ğ‘ƒğºconditional-setsubscriptğ‘ƒğœ”ğºğœ”superscriptâ„ğœ”D_{P}(G)=\{P_{\omega}(G)|\omega\in\mathbb{R}^{|\omega|}\}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) = { italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) | italic_Ï‰ âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_Ï‰ | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT }, where Ï‰ğœ”\omegaitalic_Ï‰ is the parameter of method Pğ‘ƒPitalic_P, |Ï‰|ğœ”|\omega|| italic_Ï‰ | denotes the dimensionality of the parameter Ï‰ğœ”\omegaitalic_Ï‰, and Pğ‘ƒPitalic_P represents either GPF or All In One prompt method. We denote PÏ‰â¢(G)subscriptğ‘ƒğœ”ğºP_{\omega}(G)italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) as GÏ‰subscriptğºğœ”G_{\omega}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and the corresponding diffusion matrix and node feature matrix Sğ‘†Sitalic_S and Xğ‘‹Xitalic_X after prompt as SÏ‰subscriptğ‘†ğœ”S_{\omega}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and XÏ‰subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”X_{\omega}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT respectively.

Hence, the graph embedding vector obtained from graph GÏ‰subscriptğºğœ”G_{\omega}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT prompted by PÏ‰subscriptğ‘ƒğœ”P_{\omega}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT after passing through the GNN model FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT can be denoted as FÎ¸â¢(GÏ‰)subscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscriptğºğœ”F_{\theta}(G_{\omega})italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

Then, we can take each graph GÏ‰subscriptğºğœ”G_{\omega}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT from the transformation space DPâ¢(G)subscriptğ·ğ‘ƒğºD_{P}(G)italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) and pass it through the GNN model FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to obtain the corresponding embedding vector. These embedding vectors can be collected into a set, the transformation embedding vector set:

{FÎ¸â¢(GÏ‰)|Â for allÂ â¢GÏ‰âˆˆDPâ¢(G)}conditional-setsubscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscriptğºğœ”Â for allÂ subscriptğºğœ”subscriptğ·ğ‘ƒğº\{F_{\theta}(G_{\omega})|\text{ for all }G_{\omega}\in D_{P}(G)\}{ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | for all italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) } (19)

Here, FÎ¸â¢(GÏ‰)subscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscriptğºğœ”F_{\theta}(G_{\omega})italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) can be expressed in formula form as:

FÎ¸â¢(GÏ‰)=ReadOutâ¢(Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢(â‹¯â¢Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢XÏ‰â¢W)â¢â‹¯)â¢W))=ReadOutâ¢(H(n))subscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscriptğºğœ”ReadOutğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”â‹¯ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”ğ‘Šâ‹¯ğ‘ŠReadOutsuperscriptğ»ğ‘›F_{\theta}(G_{\omega})=\text{ReadOut}(\sigma(S_{\omega}(\cdots\sigma(S_{\omega% }X_{\omega}W)\cdots)W))=\text{ReadOut}(H^{(n)})italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ReadOut ( italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹¯ italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ) â‹¯ ) italic_W ) ) = ReadOut ( italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) (20)

Where, the dots (â‹¯)â‹¯(\cdots)( â‹¯ ) indicate that the parentheses are nested nğ‘›nitalic_n times, representing nğ‘›nitalic_n iterations of the message passaging and aggregation. nğ‘›nitalic_n is the number of layers. H(n)superscriptğ»ğ‘›H^{(n)}italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the n-th embedding matrix.

ReadOut process is viewed as the linear combination of the embedding matrix Hğ»Hitalic_H, i.e. ReadOutâ¢(H(n))=ğ°â¢H(n)ReadOutsuperscriptğ»ğ‘›ğ°superscriptğ»ğ‘›\text{ReadOut}(H^{(n)})=\mathbf{w}H^{(n)}ReadOut ( italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = bold_w italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, where ğ°ğ°\mathbf{w}bold_w is determined by the pre-trained model.

Specifically, we denote the process of obtaining the n-th order embedding matrix (i.e. final embedding matrix) as:

KÎ¸â¢(GÏ‰)=H(n)=Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢(â‹¯â¢Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢XÏ‰â¢W)â¢â‹¯)â¢W)subscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğºğœ”superscriptğ»ğ‘›ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”â‹¯ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”ğ‘Šâ‹¯ğ‘ŠK_{\theta}(G_{\omega})=H^{(n)}=\sigma(S_{\omega}(\cdots\sigma(S_{\omega}X_{% \omega}W)\cdots)W)italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹¯ italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ) â‹¯ ) italic_W ) (21)

A.2.1 On the Range of Graph Embedding Matrix After Graph Prompting, one prompt node case

Lemma 1 (Transformation of Graph after Prompt).

Here we consider GPF and All-in-One methods. Without loss of generality, we assume that the prompt subgraph in All-in-One has only one node.

For GPF, the prompt vector is added to each node of graph GğºGitalic_G, while the topological connections of the graph remain unchanged. Therefore:

SÏ‰=S,XÏ‰=X+ğŸNâ¢ğ©âŠ¤formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘†ğœ”ğ‘†subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”ğ‘‹subscript1ğ‘superscriptğ©topS_{\omega}=S,\quad X_{\omega}=X+\mathbf{1}_{N}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_S , italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_X + bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (22)

Where Nğ‘Nitalic_N is the number of nodes in the graph, pğ‘pitalic_p is the prompt vector, pâˆˆâ„Fğ‘superscriptâ„ğ¹p\in\mathbb{R}^{F}italic_p âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, Fğ¹Fitalic_F represents the dimension of the parameter vector, ğŸNsubscript1ğ‘\mathbf{1}_{N}bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a vector âˆˆâ„Nabsentsuperscriptâ„ğ‘\in\mathbb{R}^{N}âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with every component to be 1111.

For All-in-One, the prompt subgraph is connected to graph GğºGitalic_G in a parameterized way, i.e. there exist parameters that control the connection relationship between any two nodes in the prompt subgraph and the original graph.(as defined in A.1.1). Therefore:

SÏ‰=(SllâŠ¤SNâ¢N),XÏ‰=X+ğNâ¢ğ©âŠ¤formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘†ğœ”matrixğ‘†ğ‘™superscriptğ‘™topsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘ğ‘subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”ğ‘‹subscriptğğ‘superscriptğ©topS_{\omega}=\begin{pmatrix}S&l\\ l^{\top}&S_{NN}\end{pmatrix},\quad X_{\omega}=X+\mathbf{e}_{N}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_S end_CELL start_CELL italic_l end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_l start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ) , italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_X + bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (23)

Where lâˆˆâ„Nâˆ’1ğ‘™superscriptâ„ğ‘1l\in\mathbb{R}^{N-1}italic_l âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a column vector, liâ‰¥0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘–0l_{i}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, âˆ€iâˆˆ{1,â‹¯,Nâˆ’1}for-allğ‘–1â‹¯ğ‘1\forall i\in\{1,\cdots,N-1\}âˆ€ italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , â‹¯ , italic_N - 1 }. In summary, the transformation of XÏ‰subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”X_{\omega}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT can be denoted as:

XÏ‰=X+ğœğ©âŠ¤,whereÂ â¢ğœiâ‰¥0formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘‹ğœ”ğ‘‹superscriptğœğ©topwhereÂ subscriptğœğ‘–0X_{\omega}=X+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top},\quad\text{where }\mathbf{c}_{i}\geq 0italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_X + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , where bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0 (24)

Where ğ•”ğ•”\mathbb{c}blackboard_c can be referred to as the coefficient vector.

Lemma 2 (Range of Embedding Matrix after Nonlinear Transformation).

Consider a weight matrix Wâˆˆâ„FÃ—Fğ‘Šsuperscriptâ„ğ¹ğ¹W\in\mathbb{R}^{F\times F}italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F Ã— italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and let Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W ) denote its row space. Suppose there exists a matrix Rğ‘…Ritalic_R such that each row of matrix Rğ‘…Ritalic_R is taken from the space Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W ). Let ğœğœ\mathbf{c}bold_c be a vector with ciâ‰¥0subscriptğ‘ğ‘–0c_{i}\geq 0italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, and let â„â„\mathcal{I}caligraphic_I be the set of indices where ğœğœ\mathbf{c}bold_c takes strictly positive values. Let ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p be vector spans Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W )(i.e. could take any value in Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W )).

Now, we consider R+ğœğ©âŠ¤ğ‘…superscriptğœğ©topR+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_R + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For iâˆˆâ„ğ‘–â„i\in\mathcal{I}italic_i âˆˆ caligraphic_I, the iğ‘–iitalic_i-th row of R+ğœğ©âŠ¤ğ‘…superscriptğœğ©topR+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_R + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is: RiâŠ¤+ciâ¢ğ©âŠ¤superscriptsubscriptğ‘…ğ‘–topsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptğ©topR_{i}^{\top}+c_{i}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT where ci>0subscriptğ‘ğ‘–0c_{i}>0italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, RiâˆˆRâ¢(W)subscriptğ‘…ğ‘–ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR_{i}\in R(W)italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_R ( italic_W ), ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p spans Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W ). Therefore, RiâŠ¤+ciâ¢ğ©âŠ¤âˆˆRâ¢(W)superscriptsubscriptğ‘…ğ‘–topsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptğ©topğ‘…ğ‘ŠR_{i}^{\top}+c_{i}\mathbf{p}^{\top}\in R(W)italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_R ( italic_W ), and spans Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W ). For iâˆ‰â„ğ‘–â„i\notin\mathcal{I}italic_i âˆ‰ caligraphic_I, c=0ğ‘0c=0italic_c = 0, the iğ‘–iitalic_i-th row of R+ğœğ©âŠ¤ğ‘…superscriptğœğ©topR+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_R + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is simply RiâŠ¤superscriptsubscriptğ‘…ğ‘–topR_{i}^{\top}italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Hence, R+ğœğ©âŠ¤ğ‘…superscriptğœğ©topR+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_R + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT can be written in the form of Râ€²+(Î”â¢R+ğœğ©âŠ¤)superscriptğ‘…â€²Î”ğ‘…superscriptğœğ©topR^{\prime}+(\Delta R+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top})italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( roman_Î” italic_R + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), where ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p spans Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W ), Râ€²superscriptğ‘…â€²R^{\prime}italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT represents the matrix with the rows whose index iâˆ‰â„ğ‘–â„i\notin\mathcal{I}italic_i âˆ‰ caligraphic_I, and all other rows set to zero. Î”â¢R=Râˆ’Râ€²Î”ğ‘…ğ‘…superscriptğ‘…â€²\Delta R=R-R^{\prime}roman_Î” italic_R = italic_R - italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Noted that every row of Î”â¢R+ğœğ©âŠ¤Î”ğ‘…superscriptğœğ©top\Delta R+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top}roman_Î” italic_R + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with index iâˆˆâ„ğ‘–â„i\in\mathcal{I}italic_i âˆˆ caligraphic_I, such row vector spans Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W ), as shown above, regardless of what the specific matrix Î”â¢RÎ”ğ‘…\Delta Rroman_Î” italic_R is. Hence, the expressive power of graph prompting does not fundamentally differ for different Î”â¢RÎ”ğ‘…\Delta Rroman_Î” italic_R. We claim that from the perspective of embedding vectors (i.e., if the same embedding vectors can be produced through Readout, we donâ€™t distinguish the specific form of the matrix), we can simplify Î”â¢RÎ”ğ‘…\Delta Rroman_Î” italic_R into ğœğ©ğŸâŠ¤superscriptsubscriptğœğ©0top\mathbf{cp_{0}^{\top}}bold_cp start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, where ğœğœ\mathbf{c}bold_c is exactly the same ğœğœ\mathbf{c}bold_c as the ğœğœ\mathbf{c}bold_c in the assumption in the lemma, ğ©0âˆˆRâ¢(W)subscriptğ©0ğ‘…ğ‘Š\mathbf{p}_{0}\in R(W)bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_R ( italic_W ) is a vector with the same size as ğœğœ\mathbf{c}bold_c. More detailed discussion refer to A.4. In this way, the calculation is greatly simplified.

Now, consider adding a nonlinear function Ïƒâ¢(â‹…)=Leaky-ReLUâ¢(â‹…)ğœâ‹…Leaky-ReLUâ‹…\sigma(\cdot)=\text{Leaky-ReLU}(\cdot)italic_Ïƒ ( â‹… ) = Leaky-ReLU ( â‹… ). We examine Ïƒâ¢(Râ€²+Î”â¢R+ğœğ©âŠ¤)ğœsuperscriptğ‘…â€²Î”ğ‘…superscriptğœğ©top\sigma(R^{\prime}+\Delta R+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top})italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Î” italic_R + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ):

Scenario 1: When Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W has full row rank, i.e., ğ©âŠ¤superscriptğ©top\mathbf{p}^{\top}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, Ïƒâ¢(ğ©âŠ¤)ğœsuperscriptğ©top\sigma(\mathbf{p}^{\top})italic_Ïƒ ( bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) spans â„Fsuperscriptâ„ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. In this case, for each row, we have:

For iâˆˆâ„ğ‘–â„i\in\mathcal{I}italic_i âˆˆ caligraphic_I

Ïƒâ¢(Riâ€²â£âŠ¤+Î”â¢R+ciâ¢ğ©âŠ¤)=Ïƒâ¢(Riâ€²â£âŠ¤+ciâ¢ğ©âŠ¤+ciâ¢ğ©0âŠ¤)ğœsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘…ğ‘–â€²topÎ”ğ‘…subscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptğ©topğœsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘…ğ‘–â€²topsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptğ©topsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ©0top\displaystyle\sigma(R_{i}^{\prime\top}+\Delta R+c_{i}\mathbf{p}^{\top})=\sigma% (R_{i}^{\prime\top}+c_{i}\mathbf{p}^{\top}+c_{i}\mathbf{p}_{0}^{\top})italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Î” italic_R + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) =Ïƒâ¢(ciâ¢(ğ©âŠ¤+ğ©ğŸâŠ¤))absentğœsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptğ©topsuperscriptsubscriptğ©0top\displaystyle=\sigma(c_{i}(\mathbf{p}^{\top}+\mathbf{p_{0}}^{\top}))= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) )

since Riâ€²=0subscriptsuperscriptğ‘…â€²ğ‘–0R^{\prime}_{i}=0italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0. After the Leaky-ReLU transformation, Ïƒâ¢(ciâ¢(ğ©âŠ¤+ğ©ğŸâŠ¤))ğœsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptğ©topsuperscriptsubscriptğ©0top\sigma(c_{i}(\mathbf{p}^{\top}+\mathbf{p_{0}}^{\top}))italic_Ïƒ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) can still span â„Fsuperscriptâ„ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Letâ€™s denote Ïƒâ¢(ğ©âŠ¤+ğ©ğŸâŠ¤)ğœsuperscriptğ©topsuperscriptsubscriptğ©0top\sigma(\mathbf{p}^{\top}+\mathbf{p_{0}}^{\top})italic_Ïƒ ( bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) as ğ©â€²â£âŠ¤superscriptğ©â€²top\mathbf{p}^{\prime\top}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, i.e. Ïƒâ¢(ğ©âŠ¤+ğ©ğŸâŠ¤)=ğ©â€²â£âŠ¤ğœsuperscriptğ©topsuperscriptsubscriptğ©0topsuperscriptğ©â€²top\sigma(\mathbf{p}^{\top}+\mathbf{p_{0}}^{\top})=\mathbf{p}^{\prime\top}italic_Ïƒ ( bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

For iâˆ‰â„ğ‘–â„i\notin\mathcal{I}italic_i âˆ‰ caligraphic_I,

Ïƒâ¢(Riâ€²â£âŠ¤+ciâ¢ğ©âŠ¤+ciâ¢ğ©0âŠ¤)ğœsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘…ğ‘–â€²topsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptğ©topsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ©0top\displaystyle\sigma(R_{i}^{\prime\top}+c_{i}\mathbf{p}^{\top}+c_{i}\mathbf{p}_% {0}^{\top})italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) =Ïƒâ¢(Riâ€²â£âŠ¤)absentğœsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘…ğ‘–â€²top\displaystyle=\sigma(R_{i}^{\prime\top})= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

we use Râ€²^iâŠ¤superscriptsubscript^superscriptğ‘…â€²ğ‘–top\hat{R^{\prime}}_{i}^{\top}over^ start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to denote Ïƒâ¢(Riâ€²â£âŠ¤)ğœsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘…ğ‘–â€²top\sigma(R_{i}^{\prime\top})italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

In conclusion, Ïƒâ¢(Râ€²+Î”â¢R+ğœğ©âŠ¤)ğœsuperscriptğ‘…â€²Î”ğ‘…superscriptğœğ©top\sigma(R^{\prime}+\Delta R+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top})italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Î” italic_R + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) can be written as R^â€²+ğœğ©â€²â£âŠ¤superscript^ğ‘…â€²superscriptğœğ©â€²top\hat{R}^{\prime}+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\prime\top}over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, where ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p, ğ©â€²superscriptğ©â€²\mathbf{p}^{\prime}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT spans â„Fsuperscriptâ„ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Note that the property of ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p and ğ©â€²superscriptğ©â€²\mathbf{p}^{\prime}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the same and there is a natural bijection between them as pointed out A.4. Without causing confusion in notation, we can use ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p to represent ğ©â€²superscriptğ©â€²\mathbf{p}^{\prime}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT here.

Scenario 2: When Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W is not full rank, ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p spans Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W ) space. In this case, row-wise, similar to Scenario 1:

Ïƒâ¢(Râ€²+ğœğ©âŠ¤)=R^â€²+ğœğ©â€²â£âŠ¤ğœsuperscriptğ‘…â€²superscriptğœğ©topsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²superscriptğœğ©â€²top\sigma(R^{\prime}+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top})=\hat{R}^{\prime}+\mathbf{c}% \mathbf{p}^{\prime\top}italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (25)

where the set of all possible values of ğ©â€²superscriptğ©â€²\mathbf{p}^{\prime}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is VÎ±subscriptğ‘‰ğ›¼V_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, defined as:

VÎ±={Leaky-ReLUâ¢(ğ¯)âˆ£ğ¯âˆˆRâ¢(W)}subscriptğ‘‰ğ›¼conditional-setLeaky-ReLUğ¯ğ¯ğ‘…ğ‘ŠV_{\alpha}=\{\text{Leaky-ReLU}(\mathbf{v})\mid\mathbf{v}\in R(W)\}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { Leaky-ReLU ( bold_v ) âˆ£ bold_v âˆˆ italic_R ( italic_W ) } (26)
Lemma 3 (Range of Embedding Matrix after Prompt, Single Layer Case).

Consider a single-layer GNN model FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. KÎ¸subscriptğ¾ğœƒK_{\theta}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT represents the embedding process for obtaining graph embedding matrix Hğ»Hitalic_H. Then, we have:

KÎ¸â¢(PÏ‰â¢(G))subscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğ‘ƒğœ”ğº\displaystyle K_{\theta}(P_{\omega}(G))italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) ) =Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢XÏ‰â¢W)absentğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”ğ‘Š\displaystyle=\sigma(S_{\omega}X_{\omega}W)= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W )
=Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢(X+ğœğ©âŠ¤)â¢W)absentğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”ğ‘‹superscriptğœğ©topğ‘Š\displaystyle=\sigma(S_{\omega}(X+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top})W)= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_W )
=Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢Xâ¢W+SÏ‰â¢ğœğ©âŠ¤â¢W)absentğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”ğ‘‹ğ‘Šsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”superscriptğœğ©topğ‘Š\displaystyle=\sigma(S_{\omega}XW+S_{\omega}\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top}W)= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X italic_W + italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_W )
=Ïƒâ¢(R+ğœâ€²â¢ğ©â€²â£âŠ¤)absentğœğ‘…superscriptğœâ€²superscriptğ©â€²top\displaystyle=\sigma(R+\mathbf{c}^{\prime}\mathbf{p}^{\prime\top})= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R + bold_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

Where R=SÏ‰â¢Xâ¢Wğ‘…subscriptğ‘†ğœ”ğ‘‹ğ‘ŠR=S_{\omega}XWitalic_R = italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X italic_W, each row of Rğ‘…Ritalic_R is a vector in the row space Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W ). ğœâ€²=SÏ‰â¢ğœsuperscriptğœâ€²subscriptğ‘†ğœ”ğœ\mathbf{c}^{\prime}=S_{\omega}\mathbf{c}bold_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_c, ciâ€²â‰¥0subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘–0c^{\prime}_{i}\geq 0italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, ğ©âŠ¤â¢W=ğ©â€²â£âŠ¤superscriptğ©topğ‘Šsuperscriptğ©â€²top\mathbf{p}^{\top}W=\mathbf{p}^{\prime\top}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_W = bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Here, ğ©â€²superscriptğ©â€²\mathbf{p}^{\prime}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT spans Râ¢(W)ğ‘…ğ‘ŠR(W)italic_R ( italic_W ) since ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p spans â„Nsuperscriptâ„ğ‘\mathbb{R}^{N}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. (ciâ€²â‰¥0subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²ğ‘–0c^{\prime}_{i}\geq 0italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0 since each element of SÏ‰subscriptğ‘†ğœ”S_{\omega}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is non-negative, the sum of each column in SÏ‰subscriptğ‘†ğœ”S_{\omega}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is strictly greater than 0 and the initial value of ğœğœ\mathbf{c}bold_c is either ğNsubscriptğğ‘\mathbf{e}_{N}bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or ğŸNsubscript1ğ‘\mathbf{1}_{N}bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Note that the number of positive terms increases in ğœğœ\mathbf{c}bold_c.)

According to lemma 2, Ïƒâ¢(R+ğœâ€²â¢ğ©â€²â£âŠ¤)ğœğ‘…superscriptğœâ€²superscriptğ©â€²top\sigma(R+\mathbf{c}^{\prime}\mathbf{p}^{\prime\top})italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R + bold_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) can be written as Râ€²^+ğœâ€²â¢ğ©â€ âŠ¤^superscriptğ‘…â€²superscriptğœâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ©â€ top\hat{R^{\prime}}+\mathbf{c}^{\prime}\mathbf{p}_{\dagger}^{\top}over^ start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + bold_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT â€  end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Here Râ€²^^superscriptğ‘…â€²\hat{R^{\prime}}over^ start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG represents the element-wise Leaky-ReLu of the rows of Rğ‘…Ritalic_R with index iâˆˆâ„ğ‘–â„i\in\mathcal{I}italic_i âˆˆ caligraphic_I and other rows take ğŸ0\mathbf{0}bold_0.ğ©â€ âŠ¤superscriptsubscriptğ©â€ top\mathbf{p}_{\dagger}^{\top}bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT â€  end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT represents ğ©âŠ¤superscriptğ©top\mathbf{p}^{\top}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p spans â„Nsuperscriptâ„ğ‘\mathbb{R}^{N}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT) if W is of full row rank; ğ©â€ âŠ¤superscriptsubscriptğ©â€ top\mathbf{p}_{\dagger}^{\top}bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT â€  end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT represents ğ©â€²â£âŠ¤superscriptğ©â€²top\mathbf{p}^{\prime\top}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (ğ©â€²superscriptğ©â€²\mathbf{p}^{\prime}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT spans VÎ±subscriptğ‘‰ğ›¼V_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT) if W is non-full-rank, VÎ±={Leaky-ReLUâ¢(ğ¯)âˆ£ğ¯âˆˆRâ¢(W)}subscriptğ‘‰ğ›¼conditional-setLeaky-ReLUğ¯ğ¯ğ‘…ğ‘ŠV_{\alpha}=\{\text{Leaky-ReLU}(\mathbf{v})\mid\mathbf{v}\in R(W)\}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { Leaky-ReLU ( bold_v ) âˆ£ bold_v âˆˆ italic_R ( italic_W ) }.

Hence, in conclusion, we have: KÎ¸â¢(PÏ‰â¢(G))=Râ€²^+ğœâ€²â¢ğ©â€ âŠ¤subscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğ‘ƒğœ”ğº^superscriptğ‘…â€²superscriptğœâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ©â€ topK_{\theta}(P_{\omega}(G))=\hat{R^{\prime}}+\mathbf{c}^{\prime}\mathbf{p}_{% \dagger}^{\top}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + bold_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT â€  end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

Lemma 4 (Range of Embedding Matrix after Prompt, Multiple Layer Full Rank Case).

Consider a multiple-layer GNN model FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then, we have:

KÎ¸â¢(GÏ‰)=Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢(â‹¯â¢Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢XÏ‰â¢W1)â¢â‹¯)â¢Wn)subscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğºğœ”ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”â‹¯ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”subscriptğ‘Š1â‹¯subscriptğ‘Šğ‘›K_{\theta}(G_{\omega})=\sigma(S_{\omega}(\cdots\sigma(S_{\omega}X_{\omega}W_{1% })\cdots)W_{n})italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹¯ italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‹¯ ) italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (27)

According to lemma 3, we have:

Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢XÏ‰â¢W1)=Râ€²^+ğœâ€²â¢ğ©â€ âŠ¤ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”subscriptğ‘Š1^superscriptğ‘…â€²superscriptğœâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ©â€ top\sigma(S_{\omega}X_{\omega}W_{1})=\hat{R^{\prime}}+\mathbf{c}^{\prime}\mathbf{% p}_{\dagger}^{\top}italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + bold_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT â€  end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (28)

We are considering the full-rank case, i.e. Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W is a full-rank matrix, according to lemma 3, we should take the equation for the full-rank case, which is:

Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢PÏ‰â¢W1)=R^1â€²+ğœ1â¢ğ©âŠ¤ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğ‘ƒğœ”subscriptğ‘Š1subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1subscriptğœ1superscriptğ©top\sigma(S_{\omega}P_{\omega}W_{1})=\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}+\mathbf{c}_{1}\mathbf{p% }^{\top}italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (29)

where ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p spans â„Nsuperscriptâ„ğ‘\mathbb{R}^{N}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, [ğœ1]iâ‰¥0subscriptdelimited-[]subscriptğœ1ğ‘–0[\mathbf{c}_{1}]_{i}\geq 0[ bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0.

For this output, consider:

Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢(R^1â€²+ğœ1â¢ğ©âŠ¤)â¢W2)=Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢R^1â€²â¢W2+ğœ2â¢ğ©âŠ¤)ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1subscriptğœ1superscriptğ©topsubscriptğ‘Š2ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1subscriptğ‘Š2subscriptğœ2superscriptğ©top\sigma(S_{\omega}(\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}+\mathbf{c}_{1}\mathbf{p}^{\top})W_{2})=% \sigma(S_{\omega}\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}W_{2}+\mathbf{c}_{2}\mathbf{p}^{\top})italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) (30)

where ğœ2=SÏ‰â¢ğœ1subscriptğœ2subscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğœ1\mathbf{c}_{2}=S_{\omega}\mathbf{c}_{1}bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, [ğœ2]i>0subscriptdelimited-[]subscriptğœ2ğ‘–0[\mathbf{c}_{2}]_{i}>0[ bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0. Compared with the equation in lemma 3, we find only Rğ‘…Ritalic_R has been replaced by SÏ‰â¢R^1â€²â¢W2subscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1subscriptğ‘Š2S_{\omega}\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}W_{2}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and components remain unchanged, so this lemma can be used again. Hence, we have:

Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢(R^1â€²+ğœ1â¢ğ©âŠ¤)â¢W2)=Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢R^1â€²â¢W2+ğœ2â¢ğ©âŠ¤)=R^2â€²+ğœ2â¢ğ©âŠ¤ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1subscriptğœ1superscriptğ©topsubscriptğ‘Š2ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1subscriptğ‘Š2subscriptğœ2superscriptğ©topsubscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²2subscriptğœ2superscriptğ©top\sigma(S_{\omega}(\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}+\mathbf{c}_{1}\mathbf{p}^{\top})W_{2})=% \sigma(S_{\omega}\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}W_{2}+\mathbf{c}_{2}\mathbf{p}^{\top})=% \hat{R}^{\prime}_{2}+\mathbf{c}_{2}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (31)

where ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p spans â„Nsuperscriptâ„ğ‘\mathbb{R}^{N}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Iteratively, we complete the entire nğ‘›nitalic_n aggregation processes of the GNN, and obtain:

KÎ¸â¢(PÏ‰â¢(G))=R^nâ€²+ğœnâ¢ğ©âŠ¤subscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğ‘ƒğœ”ğºsubscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²ğ‘›subscriptğœğ‘›superscriptğ©topK_{\theta}(P_{\omega}(G))=\hat{R}^{\prime}_{n}+\mathbf{c}_{n}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (32)

where ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p spans the â„Nsuperscriptâ„ğ‘\mathbb{R}^{N}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. (This formula can represent the expressiveness of prompt PÏ‰subscriptğ‘ƒğœ”P_{\omega}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the full-rank case)

Remark 1.

We can interpret this result as follows: (1) R^nâ€²subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²ğ‘›\hat{R}^{\prime}_{n}over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is related to the embedding matrix of the original graph GğºGitalic_G (2) ğœnâ¢ğ©âŠ¤subscriptğœğ‘›superscriptğ©top\mathbf{c}_{n}\mathbf{p}^{\top}bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT describes the additional range of the expression of GNN model after adding prompt.

A.2.2 On the Range of Graph Embedding Matrix After Graph Prompting, multiple prompt node case

Lemma 5 (Range of Embedding Matrix after multiple prompt, Single Layer Case).

We are considering single layer GNN FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT here.

For the GPF or All in one Prompt Method, we can use the following uniform formula: we have kğ‘˜kitalic_k independent prompt vectors ğ©iâˆˆâ„Fsubscriptğ©ğ‘–superscriptâ„ğ¹\mathbf{p}_{i}\in\mathbb{R}^{F}bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (or equivalently kğ‘˜kitalic_k prompt nodes with ğ©isubscriptğ©ğ‘–\mathbf{p}_{i}bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as its node feature), which form a kÃ—Fğ‘˜ğ¹k\times Fitalic_k Ã— italic_F matrix Pğ‘ƒPitalic_P, where P=(ğ©1âŠ¤â‹®ğ©kâŠ¤)ğ‘ƒmatrixsuperscriptsubscriptğ©1topâ‹®superscriptsubscriptğ©ğ‘˜topP=\begin{pmatrix}\mathbf{p}_{1}^{\top}\\ \vdots\\ \mathbf{p}_{k}^{\top}\end{pmatrix}italic_P = ( start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL â‹® end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ). Denote by Mğ‘€Mitalic_M the number of graphs in the dataset Î©Î©\Omegaroman_Î©. There exists an MÃ—kğ‘€ğ‘˜M\times kitalic_M Ã— italic_k coefficient matrix Qğ‘„Qitalic_Q, each row vector of this coefficient matrix, denoted as Qiâˆˆâ„ksubscriptğ‘„ğ‘–superscriptâ„ğ‘˜Q_{i}\in\mathbb{R}^{k}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, express how to linearly combine these kğ‘˜kitalic_k vectors to add them to itâ¢hsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘¡â„i_{th}italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT graph, i.e.:

Gi,Ï‰=(AÏ‰,X+ğœâ‹…QiâŠ¤â¢P)subscriptğºğ‘–ğœ”subscriptğ´ğœ”ğ‘‹â‹…ğœsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘„ğ‘–topğ‘ƒG_{i,\omega}=(A_{\omega},X+\mathbf{c}\cdot Q_{i}^{\top}P)italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X + bold_c â‹… italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_P )

According to lemma 3, the embedding matrix for the itâ¢hsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘¡â„i_{th}italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT graph is:

Hisubscriptğ»ğ‘–\displaystyle H_{i}italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =KÎ¸â¢(Gi,Ï‰)absentsubscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğºğ‘–ğœ”\displaystyle=K_{\theta}(G_{i,\omega})= italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
=Ïƒâ¢(Si,Ï‰â¢Xi,Ï‰â¢W)absentğœsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘–ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–ğœ”ğ‘Š\displaystyle=\sigma(S_{i,\omega}X_{i,\omega}W)= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W )
=Ïƒâ¢(Si,Ï‰â¢(Xi,Ï‰+ğŸNâ¢QiâŠ¤â¢P)â¢W)absentğœsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘–ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–ğœ”subscript1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘„ğ‘–topğ‘ƒğ‘Š\displaystyle=\sigma(S_{i,\omega}(X_{i,\omega}+\mathbf{1}_{N}Q_{i}^{\top}P)W)= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_P ) italic_W )
=Ïƒâ¢(R+ğœ1,iâ¢QiâŠ¤â¢P)absentğœğ‘…subscriptğœ1ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘„ğ‘–topğ‘ƒ\displaystyle=\sigma(R+\mathbf{c}_{1,i}Q_{i}^{\top}P)= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_P )
=Ïƒâ¢(R+ğœ1,iâ¢ğ©iâŠ¤)absentğœğ‘…subscriptğœ1ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ©ğ‘–top\displaystyle=\sigma(R+\mathbf{c}_{1,i}\mathbf{p}_{i}^{\top})= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_R + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )
=R^â€²+ğœ1,iâ¢ğ©â€²iâŠ¤absentsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²subscriptğœ1ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptsuperscriptğ©â€²ğ‘–top\displaystyle=\hat{R}^{\prime}+\mathbf{c}_{1,i}\mathbf{p^{\prime}}_{i}^{\top}= over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

Where ğ©iâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ©â€²ğ‘–\mathbf{p}^{\prime}_{i}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT spans â„Fsuperscriptâ„ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. (Implicit assumption is Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W is full rank. we are discussing the upper limit of the expressive power of graph prompting, so we should use the full-rank model with stronger expressive power)

As discussed in lemma 2, we are considering from the perspective of embedding vectors. We claim that we can write ğ©iâ€²=(Qiâ€²)âŠ¤â¢Pâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ©â€²ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘„â€²ğ‘–topsuperscriptğ‘ƒâ€²\mathbf{p}^{\prime}_{i}=(Q^{\prime}_{i})^{\top}P^{\prime}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, where Qâ€²iâŠ¤subscriptsuperscriptsuperscriptğ‘„â€²topğ‘–{Q^{\prime}}^{\top}_{i}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT denotes the itâ¢hsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘¡â„i_{th}italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT row of Qâ€²superscriptğ‘„â€²Q^{\prime}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, Qâ€²superscriptğ‘„â€²Q^{\prime}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a linear combination coefficient matrix, which is a mapping of Qğ‘„Qitalic_Q. Pâ€²superscriptğ‘ƒâ€²P^{\prime}italic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT spans â„kÃ—Fsuperscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{k\times F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k Ã— italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which is a mapping of Pğ‘ƒPitalic_P. More detailed discussion is referred to A.4.

Without causing confusion in notation, we can directly use Pğ‘ƒPitalic_P, Qğ‘„Qitalic_Q to denote Pâ€²superscriptğ‘ƒâ€²P^{\prime}italic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, Qâ€²superscriptğ‘„â€²Q^{\prime}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT here.

In summary, for a single-layer GNN with multiple prompts, the embedding matrix takes the form:

Hi=Kâ¢(Gi,Ï‰)=R^â€²+ğœ1,iâ¢ğ©iâŠ¤subscriptğ»ğ‘–ğ¾subscriptğºğ‘–ğœ”superscript^ğ‘…â€²subscriptğœ1ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ©ğ‘–topH_{i}=K(G_{i,\omega})=\hat{R}^{\prime}+\mathbf{c}_{1,i}\mathbf{p}_{i}^{\top}italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_K ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

where for any iâˆˆ{1,â€¦,M}ğ‘–1â€¦ğ‘€i\in\{1,\ldots,M\}italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , â€¦ , italic_M }, ğ©i=Qiâ¢Psubscriptğ©ğ‘–subscriptğ‘„ğ‘–ğ‘ƒ\mathbf{p}_{i}=Q_{i}Pbold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P, and R^â€²superscript^ğ‘…â€²\hat{R}^{\prime}over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is defined consistently with Lemma 3.

Lemma 6 (Range of Embedding Matrix after Prompt, Multiple Layer Case).

We now consider a multiple-layer GNN model. For this model, we have:

KÎ¸â¢(Gi,Ï‰)=Hi(n)=Ïƒâ¢(Si,Ï‰â¢(â‹¯â¢Ïƒâ¢(Si,Ï‰â¢Xi,Ï‰â¢W)â¢â‹¯)â¢W)subscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğºğ‘–ğœ”superscriptsubscriptğ»ğ‘–ğ‘›ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘–ğœ”â‹¯ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘–ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–ğœ”ğ‘Šâ‹¯ğ‘ŠK_{\theta}(G_{i,\omega})=H_{i}^{(n)}=\sigma(S_{i,\omega}(\cdots\sigma(S_{i,% \omega}X_{i,\omega}W)\cdots)W)italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹¯ italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ) â‹¯ ) italic_W )

where, according to lemma 5,

Ïƒâ¢(Si,Ï‰â¢Xi,Ï‰â¢W)=Ïƒâ¢(Si,Ï‰â¢(Xi+ğŸNâ¢Qiâ¢P)â¢W)=R^â€²+ğœ1,iâ¢pâŠ¤ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘–ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–ğœ”ğ‘Šğœsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘–ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–subscript1ğ‘subscriptğ‘„ğ‘–ğ‘ƒğ‘Šsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²subscriptğœ1ğ‘–superscriptğ‘top\sigma(S_{i,\omega}X_{i,\omega}W)=\sigma(S_{i,\omega}(X_{i}+\mathbf{1}_{N}Q_{i% }P)W)=\hat{R}^{\prime}+\mathbf{c}_{1,i}p^{\top}italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ) = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P ) italic_W ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

with ğ©âŠ¤=Qiâ¢Psuperscriptğ©topsubscriptğ‘„ğ‘–ğ‘ƒ\mathbf{p}^{\top}=Q_{i}Pbold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P, and Pğ‘ƒPitalic_P is the collection of kğ‘˜kitalic_k prompts, spans â„kÃ—Fsuperscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{k\times F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k Ã— italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT space.

This form is consistent with lemma 5, except Rğ‘…Ritalic_R is replaced by R^â€²superscript^ğ‘…â€²\hat{R}^{\prime}over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ğœ0subscriptğœ0\mathbf{c}_{0}bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is replaced by ğœ1,isubscriptğœ1ğ‘–\mathbf{c}_{1,i}bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Applying this result again, we get:

Ïƒâ¢(Si,Ï‰â¢Ïƒâ¢(Si,Ï‰â¢Xi,Ï‰â¢W1)â¢W2)ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘–ğœ”ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘–ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–ğœ”subscriptğ‘Š1subscriptğ‘Š2\displaystyle\sigma(S_{i,\omega}\sigma(S_{i,\omega}X_{i,\omega}W_{1})W_{2})italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =Ïƒâ¢(Si,Ï‰â¢(R^â€²+ğœ1,iâ¢Qiâ¢P)â¢W2)absentğœsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘–ğœ”superscript^ğ‘…â€²subscriptğœ1ğ‘–subscriptğ‘„ğ‘–ğ‘ƒsubscriptğ‘Š2\displaystyle=\sigma(S_{i,\omega}(\hat{R}^{\prime}+\mathbf{c}_{1,i}Q_{i}P)W_{2})= italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P ) italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
=R^â€²â€²+ğœ2,iâ¢Qiâ¢Pabsentsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²â€²subscriptğœ2ğ‘–subscriptğ‘„ğ‘–ğ‘ƒ\displaystyle=\hat{R}^{\prime\prime}+\mathbf{c}_{2,i}Q_{i}P= over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P

Where Pğ‘ƒPitalic_P spans â„kÃ—Fsuperscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{k\times F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k Ã— italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Iterativly applying lemma 5 nğ‘›nitalic_n times, we obtain:

KÎ¸â¢(Gi,Ï‰)=Hi(n)=R^(n)+ğœn,iâ¢piâŠ¤=R^(n)+ğœn,iâ¢QiâŠ¤â¢Psubscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğºğ‘–ğœ”superscriptsubscriptğ»ğ‘–ğ‘›superscript^ğ‘…ğ‘›subscriptğœğ‘›ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–topsuperscript^ğ‘…ğ‘›subscriptğœğ‘›ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘„ğ‘–topğ‘ƒK_{\theta}(G_{i,\omega})=H_{i}^{(n)}=\hat{R}^{(n)}+\mathbf{c}_{n,i}p_{i}^{\top% }=\hat{R}^{(n)}+\mathbf{c}_{n,i}Q_{i}^{\top}Pitalic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_P

where Pğ‘ƒPitalic_P spans â„kÃ—Fsuperscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{k\times F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k Ã— italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and Qğ‘„Qitalic_Q spans â„MÃ—ksuperscriptâ„ğ‘€ğ‘˜\mathbb{R}^{M\times k}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_M Ã— italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

In summary, for a multi-layer GNN with full-rank Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W matrices in each layer, and for a dataset Î©Î©\Omegaroman_Î© with multiple graphs and use multiple prompts Pğ‘ƒPitalic_P, we have:

KÎ¸â¢(Gi,Ï‰)=R^(n)+ğœn,iâ¢piâŠ¤=R^(n)+ğœn,iâ¢QiâŠ¤â¢Psubscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğºğ‘–ğœ”superscript^ğ‘…ğ‘›subscriptğœğ‘›ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–topsuperscript^ğ‘…ğ‘›subscriptğœğ‘›ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘„ğ‘–topğ‘ƒK_{\theta}(G_{i,\omega})=\hat{R}^{(n)}+\mathbf{c}_{n,i}p_{i}^{\top}=\hat{R}^{(% n)}+\mathbf{c}_{n,i}Q_{i}^{\top}Pitalic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_P

where Pğ‘ƒPitalic_P spans â„kÃ—Fsuperscriptâ„ğ‘˜ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{k\times F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k Ã— italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, Qğ‘„Qitalic_Q spans â„MÃ—ksuperscriptâ„ğ‘€ğ‘˜\mathbb{R}^{M\times k}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_M Ã— italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, for any iâˆˆ{1,â€¦,M}ğ‘–1â€¦ğ‘€i\in\{1,\ldots,M\}italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , â€¦ , italic_M }.

A.2.3 On the Range of Graph Embedding Matrix After Graph Prompting, Not Full-Rank Case

Lemma 7 (Range of Embedding after Prompt, Multiple Layer Non-Full Rank Case).

We consider a multiple-layer GNN model FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with a potential non-full-rank weight matrix.
We have:

KÎ¸â¢(GÏ‰)=Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢(â‹¯â¢Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢XÏ‰â¢W)â¢â‹¯)â¢W)subscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğºğœ”ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”â‹¯ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”ğ‘Šâ‹¯ğ‘ŠK_{\theta}(G_{\omega})=\sigma(S_{\omega}(\cdots\sigma(S_{\omega}X_{\omega}W)% \cdots)W)italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹¯ italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ) â‹¯ ) italic_W ) (33)

According to lemma 3, we have:

Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢XÏ‰â¢W)=Râ€²^+ğœâ€²â¢ğ©â€ âŠ¤ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğ‘‹ğœ”ğ‘Š^superscriptğ‘…â€²superscriptğœâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ©â€ top\sigma(S_{\omega}X_{\omega}W)=\hat{R^{\prime}}+\mathbf{c}^{\prime}\mathbf{p}_{% \dagger}^{\top}italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + bold_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT â€  end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (34)

Since we are considering the non-full rank case, according to lemma 3, we should consider the non-full rank equation:

Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢PÏ‰â¢W)=R^1â€²+ğœ1â¢ğ©âŠ¤ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğ‘ƒğœ”ğ‘Šsubscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1subscriptğœ1superscriptğ©top\sigma(S_{\omega}P_{\omega}W)=\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}+\mathbf{c}_{1}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (35)

where ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p spans the set VÎ±1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰1ğ›¼V^{1}_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as defined in lemma 3.

At this point, we can consider R^1â€²subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT equal to zero. Since, for GPF, ğœ0=ğŸNsubscriptğœ0subscript1ğ‘\mathbf{c}_{0}=\mathbf{1}_{N}bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and the monotonicity of ğœğœ\mathbf{c}bold_c implies that each component of the vector ğœğœ\mathbf{c}bold_c is strictly greater than 0. For All-in-One, ğœ=ğNğœsubscriptğğ‘\mathbf{c}=\mathbf{e}_{N}bold_c = bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We have SÏ‰=[s1,â€¦,sN]subscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğ‘ 1â€¦subscriptğ‘ ğ‘S_{\omega}=[s_{1},\ldots,s_{N}]italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], where sN=(lSNâ¢N)subscriptğ‘ ğ‘matrixğ‘™subscriptğ‘†ğ‘ğ‘s_{N}=\begin{pmatrix}l\\ S_{NN}\end{pmatrix}italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_l end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ), ğœâ€²=sNsuperscriptğœâ€²subscriptğ‘ ğ‘\mathbf{c}^{\prime}=s_{N}bold_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. we assume l>0ğ‘™0l>0italic_l > 0 component-wise(This can be achieved by adjusting parameters in All in one), then ğœâ€²superscriptğœâ€²\mathbf{c}^{\prime}bold_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is component-wise >0absent0>0> 0.

Recall that R1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘…â€²1R^{\prime}_{1}italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT only preserves rows where the corresponding component of ğœ=0ğœ0\mathbf{c}=0bold_c = 0. Hence, R^1â€²subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT can be considered to be zero.

For this output, we consider:

Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢(R^1â€²+ğœ1â¢ğ©âŠ¤)â¢W)=Ïƒâ¢(SÏ‰â¢(ğœ1â¢ğ©âŠ¤)â¢W)=Ïƒâ¢(ğœ2â¢ğ©â€²âŠ¤)=ğœ2â¢ğ©â€²â€²âŠ¤ğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1subscriptğœ1superscriptğ©topğ‘Šğœsubscriptğ‘†ğœ”subscriptğœ1superscriptğ©topğ‘Šğœsubscriptğœ2superscriptsuperscriptğ©â€²topsubscriptğœ2superscriptsuperscriptğ©â€²â€²top\sigma(S_{\omega}(\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}+\mathbf{c}_{1}\mathbf{p}^{\top})W)=% \sigma(S_{\omega}(\mathbf{c}_{1}\mathbf{p}^{\top})W)=\sigma(\mathbf{c}_{2}% \mathbf{p^{\prime}}^{\top})=\mathbf{c}_{2}\mathbf{p^{\prime\prime}}^{\top}italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_W ) = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_W ) = italic_Ïƒ ( bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (36)

Here, ğ©â€²âŠ¤=ğ©âŠ¤â¢Wsuperscriptsuperscriptğ©â€²topsuperscriptğ©topğ‘Š\mathbf{p^{\prime}}^{\top}=\mathbf{p}^{\top}Wbold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_W. This demonstrates that: (1). ğ©â€²superscriptğ©â€²\mathbf{p}^{\prime}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT spans VÎ±1â¢Wsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰1ğ›¼ğ‘ŠV^{1}_{\alpha}Witalic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W (2). ğ©â€²âˆˆRâ¢(W)superscriptğ©â€²ğ‘…ğ‘Š\mathbf{p}^{\prime}\in R(W)\vspace{0.15cm}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_R ( italic_W ). Hence, the set of the range of ğ©â€²superscriptğ©â€²\mathbf{p^{\prime}}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is only a linear transformation to VÎ±1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰1ğ›¼V^{1}_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, i.e. VÎ±1â¢Wsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰1ğ›¼ğ‘ŠV^{1}_{\alpha}Witalic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W. The set of the range of ğ©â€²â€²superscriptğ©â€²â€²\mathbf{p^{\prime\prime}}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is operating Leaky-ReLU to the set VÎ±1â¢Wsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰1ğ›¼ğ‘ŠV^{1}_{\alpha}Witalic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W, i.e. Ïƒâ¢(VÎ±1â¢W)ğœsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰1ğ›¼ğ‘Š\sigma(V^{1}_{\alpha}W)italic_Ïƒ ( italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ), denoted by VÎ±2subscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰2ğ›¼V^{2}_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Iteratively, We have:

FÎ¸â¢(GÏ‰)=ğœnâ¢ğ©(n)âŠ¤subscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscriptğºğœ”subscriptğœğ‘›superscriptğ©limit-fromğ‘›topF_{\theta}(G_{\omega})=\mathbf{c}_{n}\mathbf{p}^{(n)\top}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = bold_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (37)

where ğ©(n)superscriptğ©ğ‘›\mathbf{p}^{(n)}bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT spans VÎ±nsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰ğ‘›ğ›¼V^{n}_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Specifically, according to lemma 12, VÎ±nsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰ğ‘›ğ›¼V^{n}_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a cone surface, i.e., for any ğ¯âˆˆVÎ±nğ¯subscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰ğ‘›ğ›¼\mathbf{v}\in V^{n}_{\alpha}bold_v âˆˆ italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Î»âˆˆâ„+ğœ†superscriptâ„\lambda\in\mathbb{R}^{+}italic_Î» âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, Î»â¢ğ¯âˆˆVÎ±nğœ†ğ¯subscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰ğ‘›ğ›¼\lambda\mathbf{v}\in V^{n}_{\alpha}italic_Î» bold_v âˆˆ italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Remark 2.

Choosing R^1â€²subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘…â€²1\hat{R}^{\prime}_{1}over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to be zero is to simplify the calculation without affecting the theorem. Based on the principle that the minimum of the whole is less than or equal to the minimum of a part, under this assumption, we have obtained that the upper bound of the error for the prompt satisfy our assumption is certainly the upper bound for the optimal prompt.

Lemma 8 (Embedding Matrix Property, Multiple Layer GNN Non-Full Rank Case).

We consider the GNN model FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be multi-layered and could have not a full-rank weight matrix. Then, the embedding matrix of graph GğºGitalic_G, according to the iterative formula of GNN, is:

KÎ¸â¢(GÏ‰)=Ïƒâ¢(Sâ¢(â‹¯â¢Ïƒâ¢(Sâ‹…Xâ‹…W)â¢â‹¯)â¢W)subscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğºğœ”ğœğ‘†â‹¯ğœâ‹…ğ‘†ğ‘‹ğ‘Šâ‹¯ğ‘ŠK_{\theta}(G_{\omega})=\sigma(S(\cdots\sigma(S\cdot X\cdot W)\cdots)W)italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S ( â‹¯ italic_Ïƒ ( italic_S â‹… italic_X â‹… italic_W ) â‹¯ ) italic_W ) (38)

Let Sâ‹…Xâ‹…ğ‘†ğ‘‹S\cdot Xitalic_S â‹… italic_X be denoted as Xâ€²superscriptğ‘‹â€²X^{\prime}italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then Xâ€²â¢Wsuperscriptğ‘‹â€²ğ‘ŠX^{\prime}Witalic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_W is an NÃ—Fğ‘ğ¹N\times Fitalic_N Ã— italic_F embedding matrix where each row is in the row space of Wğ‘ŠWitalic_W. According to the properties of Leaky-ReLU and the definition of VÎ±1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰1ğ›¼V^{1}_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, Ïƒâ¢(Xâ€²â¢W)=Yâ€²ğœsuperscriptğ‘‹â€²ğ‘Šsuperscriptğ‘Œâ€²\sigma(X^{\prime}W)=Y^{\prime}italic_Ïƒ ( italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_W ) = italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT where each row vector is in the set VÎ±1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰1ğ›¼V^{1}_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Then Sâ¢Yâ€²=Hâ€²ğ‘†superscriptğ‘Œâ€²superscriptğ»â€²SY^{\prime}=H^{\prime}italic_S italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, where each row of Hâ€²superscriptğ»â€²H^{\prime}italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a positive linear combination of rows in Yâ€²superscriptğ‘Œâ€²Y^{\prime}italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Hence, each row of Hâ€²superscriptğ»â€²H^{\prime}italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT should also be in the convex hull of cone surface VÎ±1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰1ğ›¼V^{1}_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We name such a convex hull to be CÎ±1subscriptsuperscriptğ¶1ğ›¼C^{1}_{\alpha}italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , and further, CÎ±1subscriptsuperscriptğ¶1ğ›¼C^{1}_{\alpha}italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a convex cone. Based on lemma12, iteratively, we have each row of H(i)superscriptğ»ğ‘–H^{(i)}italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_i ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT should also be in the convex hull CÎ±isubscriptsuperscriptğ¶ğ‘–ğ›¼C^{i}_{\alpha}italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of cone surface VÎ±isubscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰ğ‘–ğ›¼V^{i}_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

We conclude the following: For any graph GğºGitalic_G, each row vector of the embedding matrix H(n)superscriptğ»ğ‘›H^{(n)}italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, obtained after applying the GNN model FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to GğºGitalic_G, lies within a specific convex cone, whose surface is exactly VÎ±nsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘‰ğ‘›ğ›¼V^{n}_{\alpha}italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT mentioned in lemma 7

Remark 3.

Lemma 8 characterizes the properties of each row vector in the embedding matrix after it has been processed by a non-full rank GNN model.

A.3 Proof of Theorem in the Paper

A.3.1 Bridge Graph Existence Theorem

Proof of Theorem 1

Proof.

For a given Goâ¢râ¢isubscriptğºğ‘œğ‘Ÿğ‘–G_{ori}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and a downstream task Tdâ¢oâ¢wsubscriptğ‘‡ğ‘‘ğ‘œğ‘¤T_{dow}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d italic_o italic_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the embedding vector corresponding to the downstream task is formally defined as the embedding vector produced by the optimal downstream model for Tdâ¢oâ¢wsubscriptğ‘‡ğ‘‘ğ‘œğ‘¤T_{dow}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d italic_o italic_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is thus uniquely determined.

Given our previous definition for the default case A.2, the FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT discussed here is a surjective mapping from the graph space {G}ğº\{G\}{ italic_G } to â„Fsuperscriptâ„ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. According to the properties of surjective mappings, for this particular Câ¢(Gori)âˆˆâ„Fğ¶subscriptğºorisuperscriptâ„ğ¹C(G_{\text{ori}})\in\mathbb{R}^{F}italic_C ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ori end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, there must exist a special graph G^brisubscript^ğºbri\hat{G}_{\text{bri}}over^ start_ARG italic_G end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bri end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that:

FÎ¸â¢(G^bri)=Câ¢(Gori)subscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscript^ğºbriğ¶subscriptğºoriF_{\theta}(\hat{G}_{\text{bri}})=C(G_{\text{ori}})italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_G end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bri end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_C ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ori end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (39)

Upon examining the definition of GbrisubscriptğºbriG_{\text{bri}}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bri end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we find that G^bri=Gbrisubscript^ğºbrisubscriptğºbri\hat{G}_{\text{bri}}=G_{\text{bri}}over^ start_ARG italic_G end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bri end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bri end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Theorem 1 is thereby proved. âˆ

A.3.2 On Error-free Mapping to Bridge Set

Proof of Theorem 3 and 4

Proof.

We aim to prove that there exists an optimal parameter Ï‰0subscriptğœ”0\omega_{0}italic_Ï‰ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that the transformed graph obtained through the graph prompting method PÏ‰0â¢(G)âˆˆBGsubscriptğ‘ƒsubscriptğœ”0ğºsubscriptğµğºP_{\omega_{0}}(G)\in B_{G}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) âˆˆ italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. This is equivalent to proving that there exists Ï‰0subscriptğœ”0\omega_{0}italic_Ï‰ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that FÎ¸â¢(PÏ‰0â¢(Goâ¢râ¢i))=FÎ¸â¢(Gbâ¢râ¢i)=Câ¢(Goâ¢râ¢i)subscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscriptğ‘ƒsubscriptğœ”0subscriptğºğ‘œğ‘Ÿğ‘–subscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscriptğºğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘–ğ¶subscriptğºğ‘œğ‘Ÿğ‘–F_{\theta}(P_{\omega_{0}}(G_{ori}))=F_{\theta}(G_{bri})=C(G_{ori})italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_C ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), where the existence of Gbâ¢râ¢isubscriptğºğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘–G_{bri}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is guaranteed by Theorem 1.

Consider a multi-layer GNN model FÎ¸subscriptğ¹ğœƒF_{\theta}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT where each layer has full-rank matrices and non-linear function Ïƒâ¢(â‹…)ğœâ‹…\sigma(\cdot)italic_Ïƒ ( â‹… ). According to lemma 4, regardless GPF or All-in-One prompt method, we have:

KÎ¸â¢(PÏ‰â¢(Goâ¢râ¢i))=H(n)=R(n)+ğœğ©âŠ¤subscriptğ¾ğœƒsubscriptğ‘ƒğœ”subscriptğºğ‘œğ‘Ÿğ‘–superscriptğ»ğ‘›superscriptğ‘…ğ‘›superscriptğœğ©topK_{\theta}(P_{\omega}(G_{ori}))=H^{(n)}=R^{(n)}+\mathbf{c}\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

Where ciâ‰¥0subscriptğ‘ğ‘–0c_{i}\geq 0italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, â€–ğœâ€–>0normğœ0\|\mathbf{c}\|>0âˆ¥ bold_c âˆ¥ > 0, ğ©ğ©\mathbf{p}bold_p spans â„Fsuperscriptâ„ğ¹\mathbb{R}^{F}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, KÎ¸â¢(â‹…)subscriptğ¾ğœƒâ‹…K_{\theta}(\cdot)italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) denote the process of obtaining the embedding matrix, R(n)superscriptğ‘…ğ‘›R^{(n)}italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT a matrix âˆˆâ„NÃ—Fabsentsuperscriptâ„ğ‘ğ¹\in\mathbb{R}^{N\times F}âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N Ã— italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which is related to the embedding matrix of the original graph GğºGitalic_G without prompting, Ï‰ğœ”\omegaitalic_Ï‰ denotes the parameter of the Prompt method.

Then, FÎ¸â¢(PÏ‰â¢(Goâ¢râ¢i))=Readoutâ¢(H(n))subscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscriptğ‘ƒğœ”subscriptğºğ‘œğ‘Ÿğ‘–Readoutsuperscriptğ»ğ‘›F_{\theta}(P_{\omega}(G_{ori}))=\text{Readout}(H^{(n)})italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = Readout ( italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). Considering the readout function as linearly combines the embedding vectors of nodes 1111 to nğ‘›nitalic_n with certain weights: ğ°=[w1,â€¦,wn]ğ°subscriptğ‘¤1â€¦subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘›\mathbf{w}=[w_{1},\ldots,w_{n}]bold_w = [ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], where wi>0subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–0w_{i}>0italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, as defined in A.2, we have:

FÎ¸â¢(PÏ‰â¢(Goâ¢râ¢i))=âˆ‘iwiâ¢Hi(n)subscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscriptğ‘ƒğœ”subscriptğºğ‘œğ‘Ÿğ‘–subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ»ğ‘›ğ‘–F_{\theta}(P_{\omega}(G_{ori}))=\sum_{i}w_{i}H^{(n)}_{i}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

Then:

FÎ¸â¢(PÏ‰â¢(Goâ¢râ¢i))=ğ°â¢R(n)+ğ°âŠ¤â¢ğœğ©âŠ¤=R0âŠ¤+Î»â¢ğ©âŠ¤subscriptğ¹ğœƒsubscriptğ‘ƒğœ”subscriptğºğ‘œğ‘Ÿğ‘–ğ°superscriptğ‘…ğ‘›superscriptğ°topsuperscriptğœğ©topsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘…0topğœ†superscriptğ©topF_{\theta}(P_{\omega}(G_{ori}))=\mathbf{w}R^{(n)}+\mathbf{w}^{\top}\mathbf{c}% \mathbf{p}^{\top}=R_{0}^{\top}+\lambda\mathbf{p}^{\top}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï‰ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = bold_w italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_cp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Î» bold_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
